reference.title: Admin
reference.shortdesc: There are several views that are available only to administrators.

dd.p: Displays a list of roles and their status in the system. The following system information is also displayed:

dlentry.dd: The number of nodes in a cluster
The version (release) number of the system
The IP address that hosts the primary node. Cluster nodes (if any) connect via this IP address. In a micro cloud setting, it is 127.0.0.1
The URL that clients target. Normally, it is also the URL for the Management Console.

dd.p: Displays a list of nodes in the current cluster, and what services are running on each node. In a micro cloud configuration, only the current local node (127.0.0.1) is displayed.

To enable or disable services on a node, click Configure Roles (cog icon) to see the Node Settings that displays a list of all available roles and allows enabling or disabling them, and then click Save.
dd.note: For information on adding nodes to a cluster, see Cluster Setip and the kato role and kato info commands.

section.title: Available Patches
section.p: Displays a list of the available patches for the current cluster.

section.title: Applications & Organizations
section.p: Displays links to the Applications and Organizations

section.title: Domains
section.p: Displays a filterable list of all domains configured on the system, indicating whether they are Shared or Owned domains

section.title: Routes
section.p: Displays a filterable list of routes in the system

dlentry.dd: Displays a filterable list of managed service instances on the system
Displays a filterable list of user provided service instances on the system
Displays a list of available service types and their versions

section.title: Users
section.p: Displays a list of users and admins.
To add users, click + Add User.
To view account details or to change passwords, click on the username or email address.

section.title: Quota Plans
section.p: Displays a list of the quota plans available to apply to organizations on the system. To edit a definition, click the Edit button on the right. The following fields can be modified:

dd.p: The definition name. Do not change this setting without also changing the settings of any organization using the definition.

dlentry.dd: The total amount of app RAM (in MB) that can be allocated to user applications.
The total number of service instances that can be allocated.
The total number of routes that can be created.
The number of droplets stored (per app) for versioning and rollback.
Allow users in the organizations to have sudo privileges within their application containers.

section.p: To create a new definition, use the quota create command.

dlentry.dd:
Tracks and displays the amount of memory used by applications across all DEA nodes and displays various reports. Available memory is calculated based on the system memory of the DEA nodes multiplied by the Max Memory Percentage. Memory Summary displays how much memory
Has been assigned to organizations via Quota Plans
Is available on DEA nodes
Remains unallocated
Has been allocated
Is currently in use
Displays memory usage statistics and a usage bar graph for each DEA node in the pool
Displays memory usage statistics and a usage bar graph for all configured Placement Zones
Displays memory usage statistics and a usage bar graph for all configured Availability Zones
Displays realtime results for incoming requests (connections per second), routing errors (errors per second), and an overview of the cumulative requests to the system.

Displays graphs for server statistics:
CPU
Load
Memory
Disk Operations
Disk Space
Processes
Swap (primary node or micro cloud only)

section.title: Cloud Events
section.p: Displays a list of events (including errors and warnings) on the server. These events can be filtered by Severity, Node ID, or Type, or using a substring match in the Search field.
